Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD's decision to uphold the RPD's rejection of the applicant's refugee claim based on credibility issues was reasonable
Evidence_Assessment: Contradictions in testimony, delays in filing
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected the claim, RAD upheld the rejection
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to establish credibility and basis for refugee protection
Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies in testimony and delays in filing
Legal_Rule: RAD reviews RPD decisions using a reasonableness standard with deference to credibility findings unless there is an overriding error
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of credibility
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Canadian administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Credibility assessment by RPD and upheld by RAD
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory framework and jurisprudence on reasonableness review
Remedy_Requested: Overturning of RAD decision, acceptance of refugee claim
Decision_Authority: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative appeal and federal court review
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and appeals
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Credibility concerns regarding domestic violence claim
Applicable_Process: Refugee determination process, appeal before RAD, judicial review in Federal Court
Outcome_of_Review: No intervention by Federal Court; decision upheld
Governing_Rule: Principles of administrative law on reasonableness and deference
